etymology.culturalSignificance: Iris is associated with the Greek goddess of the rainbow and a messenger. In various cultures, it symbolizes hope and connection.
etymology.historicalNotes: The name Iris has been used since ancient Greek times, denoting beauty and divine communication. It also gained popularity in the Renaissance period as an emblematic flower name.

sounds.description: diphthong starting from open front vowel to near-close front vowel

phonetics.rhythm: The name flows smoothly with alternating stresses, giving it a lyrical quality.
phonetics.phonosemantic: The sounds convey brightness and clarity, evoking imagery of light and beauty.

morphology.grammaticalJourney: Originally a common noun referring to the rainbow, it transitioned into a proper noun through mythological and floral significance. Its use as a name reflects its rich cultural heritage.

famousBearers: Iris Apfel (American businesswoman and fashion icon)
